resources.string: The first Ferris wheel made its debut in Chicago at the 1893 World\'s Columbian Exposition
The Willis Tower is the tallest building in the world.
Chicago has the largest collection of Impressionist paintings outside of Paris.
The term \"Jazz\" was coined in Chicago in 1914.
Spray paint was invented in Chicago in 1949
Chicago was incorporated as a city in 1817
The atom was first split (leading to the A bomb and nuclear power) at the University of Chicago.
Chicago\'s nicknames include: The Windy City, the City of Big Shoulders, the Second City, and The City That Works.
Chicago River is the only river in the world that flows backward.
The Hull House opened in 1923 to aid Chicago immigrants.
